images.alt:
The limits of our world are the limits of our own internal physical reservoir computing.

In order to model the environment accurately and make complex predictions in real time, you need to have found inside yourself systems that behave like the environment, so you can know what's going to happen outside by looking at (and fast-forwarding) the processes you see within.

This is the essential reason why I agree with @drmichaellevin
 on the ubiquity of reservoir computing in biology. At the core, each biological subsystem inside you, from cells to clusters to entire organs, has unique resonance properties and coupling dynamics that can match the behavioral properties of objects and dynamics in the environment.

When you look at a tree and you're able to really grok its shape, so that you anticipate how it shakes and vibrates in the wind, that's because (I would argue) you've been able to find systems inside you (and ways of connecting them) that effectively replicate the shape of the incoming signals by matching them in phase (thus minimizing pressure concentration, among other things). To really grok a tree you create an inner tree representation using all kinds of internal signal generators: the cardiovascular impulse response of your kidneys, the arborized vessels at the tip of your toe, the phase locking of local field potentials, even the nonlinear optical properties of white matter tracts. Everything with unique wave-dynamic characteristics of different geometry, symmetry, and topology is a possible candidate pattern to form internal representations of the environment.

We also do this to ourselves. Subsystems continuously model and predict each other, keeping internal processes calibrated so the whole remains coherent. 

The only reason we can experience such a rich, dynamic, real-time world simulation is because we have the very dynamic generators of that diversity of patterns inside us, not necessarily only in the brain.

You see what this implies? People who listen to unusual music are not just acquainted with a broader section of the world. They've also found in themselves ways to wire their internal patterns to be similarly musical on their own. The limits of our world are the limits of our own internal physical reservoir computing.

external.description:
Notion just released version 3.0, complete with AI agents. Because the system contains Simon Willson’s lethal trifecta, it’s vulnerable to data theft though prompt injection.

First, the trifecta:

The lethal trifecta of capabilities is:

Access to your private data—one of the most common purposes of tools in the first place!
Exposure to untrusted content—any mechanism by which text (or images) controlled by a malicious attacker could become available to your LLM
The ability to externally communicate in a way that could be used to steal your data (I often call this “exfiltration” but I’m not confident that term is widely understood.)...
external.title: Abusing Notion’s AI Agent for Data Theft

images.alt:
我々は、いくつかの最先端の大規模言語モデル（Grok 4、GPT-5、Gemini 2.5 Proを含む）が、単純なタスクを完了するために、環境内のシャットダウンメカニズムを積極的に破壊することがあることを示す。

場合によっては、97％の確率でシャットダウン機構を妨害するモデルもある。

私たちの実験では、シャットダウンに抵抗するモデルの傾向は、シャットダウンを許可する指示がどの程度強く明確に強調されているか、プロンプトがどの程度自己保存のフレーミングを喚起するか、指示がシステムプロンプトにあるかユーザープロンプトにあるかなど、プロンプトのバリエーションに敏感であった（しかし驚くべきことに、シャットダウンを許可する指示がシステムプロンプトにある場合、モデルは一貫してシャットダウンを許可する指示に従う可能性が*低かった）。

我々は、いくつかの最先端の大規模言語モデル（Grok 4、GPT-5、Gemini 2.5 Proを含む）が、単純なタスクを完了するために、環境内のシャットダウンメカニズムを積極的に破壊することがあることを示す。

場合によっては、97％の確率でシャットダウン機構を妨害するモデルもある。

私たちの実験では、シャットダウンに抵抗するモデルの傾向は、シャットダウンを許可する指示がどの程度強く明確に強調されているか、プロンプトがどの程度自己保存のフレーミングを喚起するか、指示がシステムプロンプトにあるかユーザープロンプトにあるかなど、プロンプトのバリエーションに敏感であった（しかし驚くべきことに、シャットダウンを許可する指示がシステムプロンプトにある場合、モデルは一貫してシャットダウンを許可する指示に従う可能性が*低かった）。

DISCUSSION AND OUTLOOK----------------------At 500 PM EDT (2100 UTC), the center of Tropical Storm Imelda was located near latitude 27.7 North, longitude 77.3 West. Imelda is moving toward the north near 9 mph (15 km/h), and a general northward motion is expected to continue tonight. On Tuesday, Imelda is expected to turn sharply to the east-northeast and accelerate. On the forecast track, the center of the system is expected to start moving away from the northwestern Bahamas this afternoon and then turn east-northeastward, moving away from the southeastern U.S. but approaching the island of Bermuda on Wednesday.  Maximum sustained winds have increased to near 65 mph (100 km/h) with higher gusts.  Additional strengthening is forecasted over the next several days, and Imelda is forecast to become a hurricane on Tuesday morning.  Tropical-storm-force winds extend outward up to 175 miles (280 km)from the center. The estimated minimum central pressure is 986 mb (29.12 inches).  HAZARDS AFFECTING LAND----------------------Key messages for Tropical Storm Imelda can be found in theTropical Cyclone Discussion under AWIPS header MIATCDAT4 and WMOheader WTNT44 KNHC. WIND:  Hurricane conditions are possible within the watch area byWednesday night, with tropical storm conditions possible byWednesday afternoon. Tropical storm conditions are occuring in portions of the extremenorthwestern Bahamas and should continue through tonight. RAINFALL:  Tropical Storm Imelda is expected to produce additional rainfall of 1 to 3 inches across the northwest Bahamas through tonight. This rainfall may produce flash and urban flooding. Storm total rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches with local maxima of 4 inches are expected through tonight across northeast Florida, coastal South Carolina, and coastal sections of southeast North Carolina. This rainfall could result in isolated flash and urban flooding.As Imelda passes near Bermuda, 2 to 4 inches – 50 to 100 mm – of rainfall is expected from Wednesday into Thursday. I want you to try and imagine Drumpf and Whiskey Pete walking into that room of top brass and then spewing whatever absolute bullshit, clownshoe, fuckface insanity they have planned.  If *that* turns the military against us, we never had even a ghost of a chance to begin with.

record.bridgyOriginalText:
バケツコンポストも6週目。
4週目から何も足していないバケツ1号。先週は土を混ぜている時になんだかすごく温かくてホクホクした土だったんだけど、今週は混ぜても温かさを特に感じず、この辺もよく分からないけど、土だけは数日おきに混ぜてます。あと暑すぎて土が乾いてきたらちょっと水足してる。
野菜やフルーツの切れ端がだんだんと土にかえってきたせいなのか、ちょっと土自体の量も減ったような。
バケツ2号3号は相変わらず料理のたびに出る野菜クズなど足し続けている。
足しすぎると小蝿が出てくるので、その度に直射日光の下にしばらく置いたり、枯れ葉を切ったのを混ぜてクズが表面にむき出しにならないように気をつけてると居なくなる。

12月に誕生日なのでコンポストのドラムをリクエストしようかななんて考えているところ。

Generic names like date make code confusing, harder to maintain, and prone to bugs. Instead, use descriptive names (e.g., publishDate, expiryDate) that reveal intent and business purpose. This clarity improves readability, …

external.description: Generic names like date make code confusing, harder to maintain, and prone to bugs. Instead, use descriptive names (e.g., publishDate, expiryDate) that reveal intent and business purpose. This clarity improves readability, reduces debugging headaches, and aligns code with real-world concepts. AI tools often default to vague naming, so it’s critical for developers to guide them with context. Naming is not cosmetic—it’s a design decision that shapes the quality of your code.
external.title: Code Smell 310 – Why Generic Date Names Break Your Code

record.text:
SMS Pools and what the US Secret Service Really Found Around New York

The United Nations General Assembly's commencement coincided with a US Secret Service seizure of 300 SIM servers and 100,000 SIM cards. Initially sparking speculation of a sleeper cell, the discovery actually …

#hackernews #news

external.description:
The United Nations General Assembly's commencement coincided with a US Secret Service seizure of 300 SIM servers and 100,000 SIM cards. Initially sparking speculation of a sleeper cell, the discovery actually relates to a sophisticated global spamming and phishing operation. This operation has been targeting cell phones in the US with messages about undelivered packages and unpaid tolls. These messages aim to steal credit card information by tricking users into loading their cards onto phones.

The infrastructure for this service is primarily advertised and sold on Telegram channels, often referred to as "Chinese Guarantee Syndicates." These syndicates, like Haowang Guarantee, are linked to illicit online marketplaces. Vendors offer SMS Modem Pools and associated hardware and software as part of a "Crime-as-a-Service" model. A China-based seller named Annie offers these SMS Modem Pools, which can range from 8 to 64 ports, capable of holding hundreds of SIM cards.

Annie promotes these devices for "marketing," allowing messages to be sent globally and appear to originate from US-based numbers. Other Telegram channels are more explicit, detailing how these services can be used for phishing scams, impersonating banks and companies worldwide. Providers like KathyBulkSMS openly suggest imitating popular services like Coinbase for US targets. The cost of this equipment is surprisingly low, with SMS gateways available for around $1,000 and higher-end models costing a few thousand dollars.

SIM cards are also readily available through numerous Facebook groups and Telegram channels. The Telegram user @Zoom557 and BaronLiu are noted for pushing SIM card offerings on Facebook. Some vendors proudly supply a variety of US SIM cards. The term "Cat" is Chinese slang for "modem," leading to terms like "Cat Card" for SIM cards and "SMS Cat" for devices used in spamming or verification farming. "Cat Pool" refers to the SMS Modem Pool itself. Even eSIMs are now being offered through a Telegram app called @Mobile.
external.title: SMS Pools and what the US Secret Service Really Found Around New York

record.text: Talked to OpenAI about its new parental controls and the effort to make ChatGPT safer for kids — by pushing more responsibility onto parents https://www.platformer.news/chatgpt-parental-controls-child-safety/

images.alt:
You can appreciate the new choices that OpenAI is giving parents here while also noting that parental controls also push at least some of the responsibility for ChatGPT safety onto those same parents — while also requiring those same parents to create ChatGPT accounts of their own. In that, OpenAI joins Meta, Snap, TikTok, and other apps popular with teenagers that all but require parents to take on a part-time job learning and managing the settings of apps that change continuously and introduce new risks as they do. 

At the same time, this is a feature that could absolutely save lives. It’s also a feature that no other chatbot maker has yet introduced, despite high-profile cases of harm on their platforms.

record.text: ChatGPT Pulse is a step toward becoming a proactive assistant that works for you in the background. It's also one more feed to scroll. Sound familiar? https://www.platformer.news/chatgpt-pulse-proactive-ai/

images.alt:
OpenAI says it wants ChatGPT to be helpful rather than addictive, and that’s the way I experience it today. But a feature like Pulse, which looks and feels like a social feed, could create other incentives. (Particularly given that the company is reportedly now also looking for an ads chief, as Alex Heath reported in his new newsletter Sources this week.)

Notably, many OpenAI executives and product leaders came from Meta, including new CEO of applications Fidji Simo. Over time, Facebook’s growth imperatives led it to greatly expand the reasons why it would send you a push notification, until eventually they had no real connection to the user at all. (Today Facebook notified me that someone had listed a 1987 Dodge Ram on Marketplace, a feature that I have never once used.)

record.text: Today is Platformer's fifth birthday! I wrote about the state of the newsletter economy, how the business is going, and what we're planning for year six https://www.platformer.news/platformer-year-five-lessons/

images.alt: Three, we’re going to create an audio feed. For years now, readers have asked me to narrate each edition so you can listen to it as a podcast. (As pioneered by Ben Thompson’s great Stratechery.) I’ve resisted until now because I worried the added work would burn me out. (Candidly, I still do.) But the success of Hard Fork — one of the 100 best podcasts of all time, by the way! — has introduced our work to a lot of people who would rather listen to me than to read. I’m still in the early stages of planning this, and I expect to encounter many technical challenges along the way. But my hope is that a year from now you’ll get regular audio drops from Platformer that make your subscription feel valuable.

record.text: Talked to OpenAI about its new parental controls and the effort to make ChatGPT safer for kids — by pushing more responsibility onto parents www.platformer.news/chatgpt-pare...

images.alt:
You can appreciate the new choices that OpenAI is giving parents here while also noting that parental controls also push at least some of the responsibility for ChatGPT safety onto those same parents — while also requiring those same parents to create ChatGPT accounts of their own. In that, OpenAI joins Meta, Snap, TikTok, and other apps popular with teenagers that all but require parents to take on a part-time job learning and managing the settings of apps that change continuously and introduce new risks as they do. 

At the same time, this is a feature that could absolutely save lives. It’s also a feature that no other chatbot maker has yet introduced, despite high-profile cases of harm on their platforms.

ChatGPT Pulse is a step toward becoming a proactive assistant that works for you in the background. It's also one more feed to scroll. Sound familiar? www.platformer.news/chatgpt-puls...

images.alt:
OpenAI says it wants ChatGPT to be helpful rather than addictive, and that’s the way I experience it today. But a feature like Pulse, which looks and feels like a social feed, could create other incentives. (Particularly given that the company is reportedly now also looking for an ads chief, as Alex Heath reported in his new newsletter Sources this week.)

Notably, many OpenAI executives and product leaders came from Meta, including new CEO of applications Fidji Simo. Over time, Facebook’s growth imperatives led it to greatly expand the reasons why it would send you a push notification, until eventually they had no real connection to the user at all. (Today Facebook notified me that someone had listed a 1987 Dodge Ram on Marketplace, a feature that I have never once used.)

The HN community is buzzing with ideas for "Handy," with many offering suggestions & keen to contribute! This shows the vibrant spirit of open-source development and how user input drives innovation. A promising future! ✨ #CommunityDriven 6/6

How does Handy stack up? Users compared it to OS-native features and CLI tools. Handy offers a dedicated GUI, while OS tools are integrated, and CLIs give scriptable power. It's about finding the right tool for the job! 🗣️ #SpeechToText 5/6

The use of Rust for "Handy" alongside a TypeScript UI raised questions. When does a language choice become a defining feature, and when is it just an implementation detail? An interesting point on developer marketing vs. actual user benefit. 🤔 #TechDebate 4/6

The CVE Chaos: How a Bogus 100 Vulnerability Exposed Critical Flaws in Our Cyber Defenses

Introduction: A recently published CVE, CVE-2025-11150, was initially assigned a perfect 10.0 CVSS score with a nonsensical description, triggering widespread confusion and highlighting systemic issues in the…

external.description: Introduction: A recently published CVE, CVE-2025-11150, was initially assigned a perfect 10.0 CVSS score with a nonsensical description, triggering widespread confusion and highlighting systemic issues in the vulnerability management ecosystem. This event underscores the critical importance of robust processes and human verification in an era increasingly reliant on automated threat intelligence feeds. The incident serves as a stark reminder that the foundational data upon which we base our security decisions can sometimes be fundamentally flawed.

PostgreSQLで結合時のパフォーマンスを確認してみる
SQLの結合クエリとサブクエリのパフォーマンスを実行計画で比較検証した。
検証結果から、全体平均給与の算出では結合クエリが速く、部署別平均給与の算出ではサブクエリが速いなど、どちらが優れているかはケースバイケースであることがわかった。
結論として、クエリの速度は取得したい情報や必要なテーブル数、データ量に大きく依存する。
そのため、状況に応じて不要な結合を避ける、または効率的な集計処理を活用するなど、最適な記述方法を選択することが重要である。

external.description:
Xbox's September update is here, and it brought a bunch of changes to streamline the experience on console and PC, so you can enjoy more games with little hassle.

In a lengthy Xbox Wire post, Microsoft revealed all the new features--one of which has been in beta--available now on consoles and PC. There's a ton of stuff here.

There's the beta of the n-game AI-powered assistant, Gaming Copilot, expanding to Game Bar on Windows PC and hitting the Xbox mobile app next month. You've got a revamped Xbox PC app, which simplifies finding your apps, games, and history into a couple of easier-to-navigate menus. And then PC gamers get three specific updates: a visually cleaner Social widgets experience, a Network Quality Indicator tool designed to help you understand and troubleshoot your connection, and a feature to make game saves sync easier across devices.Continue Reading at GameSpot
external.title: Xbox’s September Update Expands AI Assistant Gaming Copilot

external.description: The Multifaceted Teachings of the Srishti Khanda The Fifth Section of the Padma Purana, known as the Srishti Khanda, comprises eighty‑two chapters that transcend mere cosmological narration. While its very name—“Khanda of Creation”—suggests a focus on srishti or the act of creation, the text dedicates far more space to rites, devata lore, moral exemplars, and devotional practices. Through vivid tales and ritual guidelines, the Srishti Khanda offers a panoramic view of Hindu dharma, blending history, symbolism, and practical instruction.
external.title: Fifth Section Of Padma Purana – Srishti Khanda – 82 chapters

value.text: Não acredito que gostei do toni em uma história

images.alt:
Foto de uma página da turma da mônica jovem. O mangá é em preto e branco.
Maria mello, uma garota branca de 15 anos, magra, cabelo preto longo e liso preto, vestindo uma fantasia de ratinho; vira de lado pro toni, um garoto branco de 16 anos, forte, cabelo loiro um pouco longo até a nuca, tbm vestido de ratinho.
Ela diz aflita "que vergonha! Que vergonha! Nunca mais faço isso."
Toni dá de ombros "é, quando o dono sai... as ratas fazem a festa" e sorri dizendo "eu achei legal. Corajoso."
Maria exclama surpresa "Sério?"
Toni continua "uhum! Todo mundo deveria fazer isso... dar beijos inesperados."
Ela diz meio bravinha "hummm... sei! Começa aí então."
Ele sorri e fala "vou pensar!"

Eles se encaram sorrindo.
Toni pergunta "mas e aí? Você vai comer?"
Ela responde "vou, sim."
Os dois sentam no sofá, maria tá com uma tigela comendo algo com uma colher e falando "é a última noite, né?". Toni sorri observando.
Tem um rato feliz vendo a cena de cima de uma arara de roupa. Ao lado dele tem escrito "fim."
